title: Protocol to generate human pluripotent stem cell-derived pancreatic β cells through methionine and zinc deprivation

Step-by-step method details
Pancreatic differentiation procedure
Methionine deprivation pretreatment – Day 0
Timing: 5 h
Formed cell spheroids were treated with methionine-deprived media for 5 h before the cell differentiation procedure began.
Collect cell spheroids from one well of a 6-well suspension culture plate into a 15 mL tube using a 5 mL serological pipette.
Spin down at 190 g × 5 min.
Aspirate the supernatant and wash the cells with 5 mL of PBS (+).
Note: PBS (+) is made by adding 100× D-PBS (+) Preparation Reagent (Ca, Mg Solution) (Nacalai Tesque) into PBS solution.
Spin down at 190 g × 5 min, and aspirate the supernatant.
Resuspend the cell spheroids with 5 mL of Met (-) medium and move the cells into a 6-well suspension culture plate.
Incubate the cells at 37°C, 5% CO2 incubator at 95 rpm (0.13 × g) on a rotating orbital shaker for 5 h.
Alternatives: Spin down procedure can be changed to spontaneous sedimentation when the cell spheroid is around 100–150 μm diameter. Some cell lines yield cell spheroids smaller than 100 μm diameter. This will slow down spontaneous sedimentation. In this case, the spin-down procedure is recommended.
Stage 1: Definitive endoderm differentiation – Day 0–3
Timing: 3 days
Cell media are changed into Stage 1 medium after 5 h to induce definitive endoderm differentiation. Collect an aliquot of Stage 1 end cells for immunocytochemistry or real-time PCR analyses to examine the expression level of the definitive endoderm marker (ex. SOX17).
Collect cell spheroids from one well into a 15 mL tube using a 5 mL serological pipette and spin down at 190 g for 5 min.
Aspirate the supernatant and wash the cells with 5 mL of PBS (+).

Resuspend the cell spheroids with 5 mL of Stage 1 medium and move the cells into a new 6-well suspension culture plate.
Incubate the cells at 37°C, 5% CO2 with 95 rpm (0.13 × g) agitation on an orbital shaker.
On days 1 and 2, remove 90% of the media from each well and add an equal volume of Stage 1 medium without CHIR99021 and Y27632.
Alternatives: Spin down procedure can be changed to spontaneous sedimentation.
Note: Use a pipette to remove 4 mL of medium and gently add 4 mL of fresh medium.
Stage 2: Primitive gut tube differentiation – Day 3–6
Timing: 3 days
On day 3, cell media are changed into Stage 2 medium to induce primitive gut tube differentiation.
Collect cell spheroids from one well into a 15 mL tube and spin down at 190 g for 5 min.
Aspirate the supernatant.
Resuspend the cell spheroids with 5 mL of Stage 2 medium and move the cells into a new 6-well suspension culture plate.
Incubate the cells at 37°C, 5% CO2 with 95 rpm (0.13 × g) agitation on an orbital shaker.
On day 5, remove 90% of media from each well, and add an equal volume of Stage 2-2 medium.
Incubate the cells at 37°C, 5% CO2 with 95 rpm (0.13 × g) agitation on an orbital shaker.
Alternatives: Spin down procedure can be changed to spontaneous sedimentation.
Stage 3: Pancreatic progenitor differentiation – Day 6–8
Timing: 2 days
From day 6, cell media are changed into Stage 3 medium to induce pancreatic progenitor differentiation. A portion of Stage 3 end cells can be collected for immunocytochemistry or real-time PCR analyses. The cells will be tested for pancreatic progenitor markers and PDX1 or SOX9 expression levels.

Collect cell spheroids from one well into a 15 mL tube using a 5 mL serological pipette and spin down at 190 g for 5 min.
Aspirate the supernatant.
Resuspend the cell spheroids with 5 mL of Stage 3-1 medium and move the cells into a new 6-well suspension culture plate.
Incubate the cells at 37°C, 5% CO2 with 95 rpm (0.13 × g) agitation on an orbital shaker.
On day 7, replace 90% of media with Stage 3-2 medium.
Incubate the cells at 37°C, 5% CO2 with 95 rpm (0.13 × g) agitation on an orbital shaker.
Alternatives: Spin down procedure can be changed to spontaneous sedimentation.
Stage 4: Endocrine progenitor differentiation – Day 8–13
Timing: 5 days
Cell cultures continue with Stage 4 medium. Stage 4 end cells will contain a majority of the PDX1/NKX6-1 double-positive cell population.
Collect cell spheroids from one well into a 15 mL tube using a 5 mL serological pipette and spin down at 190 g for 5 min.
Aspirate the supernatant.
Resuspend the cell spheroids with 5 mL of Stage 4 medium and move the cells into a new 6-well suspension culture plate.
Incubate the cells at 37°C, 5% CO2 with 95 rpm (0.13 × g) agitation on an orbital shaker.
Perform medium change every other day by replacing 90% of spent media with Stage 4 medium.
Alternatives: Spin down procedure can be changed to spontaneous sedimentation.
Stage 5: Endocrine cell differentiation – Day 13–20
Timing: 8 days
This stage is to generate INS/NKX6-1 expressing endocrine cells.
Collect cell spheroids from one well into a 15 mL tube using a 5 mL serological pipette and spin down at 190 g for 5 min.
Aspirate the supernatant.

Resuspend the cell spheroids with 5 mL of Stage 5-1 medium and move the cells into a new 6-well suspension culture plate.
Incubate the cells at 37°C, 5% CO2 with 95 rpm (0.13 × g) agitation on an orbital shaker.
Perform medium change every other day.
On day 17, replace the media with Stage 5-2 medium.
Incubate the cells at 37°C, 5% CO2 with 95 rpm (0.13 × g) agitation on an orbital shaker.
Perform medium change every other day.
Alternatives: Spin down procedure can be changed to spontaneous sedimentation.
Stage 6: Reaggregation of hPSC-derived endocrine cell and pancreatic β cell differentiation – Day 20–38 or longer
Timing: 18 days or longer
Perform reaggregation of cell spheroid to further differentiate into pancreatic β cells.
Collect day 20 cell spheroids (approximately 5 × 106 cells) and wash them with 5 mL PBS.
Incubate the cell spheroids in 200 μL TrypLE Select Enzyme for 20–30 min at 37°C.
Mechanically dissociate the cell spheroids using a P1000 pipette every 10 min.
Quench the cells with 800 μL DMEM (Gibco, Cat No: 11965092) + 10% FBS and spin down.
Wash with 1–5 mL Stage 6 medium + 10 μM Y27632 and perform cell count.
Resuspend the cells at approximately 1 × 106 cells/mL in Stage 6 medium + 10 μM Y27632.
Pass through a 100 μm CellStrainer to remove any residual undissociated clusters.
Perform cell count and seed the cells into a 6-well suspension culture plate at a density of 3–6 × 106 cells per well in Stage 6 medium + 10 μM Y27632.
Incubate the cells at 37°C, 5% CO2 with 95 rpm (0.13 × g) agitation on an orbital shaker.

Note: The endocrine cells self-aggregate into clusters within 24 h. Do not disturb the cells for two days before the following medium change.
Note: Low INS-expressing cells on day 20 will lead to a low yield of cell reaggregation. Troubleshooting 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.5].
Perform medium changes every other day with Stage 6 medium and culture up to day 38 or longer.
Immunocytochemistry analysis protocol for differentiated hPSC spheroids
Timing: 3 days
Collect cell spheroids at day 3 (definitive endoderm), 8 (pancreatic progenitor), 13 (endocrine progenitor), and 21 (endocrine cell) for immunocytochemistry analysis to evaluate the differentiation efficiency of cells.
Using a 5 mL serological pipette, mix gently 2–3 times to obtain a mixture of cell spheroids in the culture wells.
Then, using a P200 pipette, collect 50 μL of cell spheroids of days 3, 8, 13, 21, or 38.
Dissociate the cells using 200 μL of TrypLE Select Enzyme for 10–20 min at 37°C.
Mechanically dissociate the cell spheroids using a P1000 pipette by mixing vigorously up and down at least 5 times. Troubleshooting 4[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.7].
Quench the cells with 800 μL media of each stage and spin down.
Wash with differentiation media and perform cell count.
Plate the cells at approximately 1 × 105 cells/well on a 96-well plate (synthemax coated) and culture overnight (16–24 h) at 37°C.
Note: Cell density of more than 1 × 105 cells/well might affect the analysis results as confluent cells are hard to be determined by imaging systems. Preferably seed to obtain approximately 80%–90% confluency cells on the next day.
The next day, fix the cells with 4% paraformaldehyde (PFA) in PBS for 30 min at RT (15°C–25°C).
Critical: Cell culture should be stopped (fix cells using 4% PFA) on the next day. Lengthening culture will cause further differentiation and affect the accuracy of the analysis.

Pause point: After fixation and 3 times PBS wash, cells can be stored at 4°C for up to one week.
Wash the cells with 0.1% Tween-20 in PBS (PBS-T) and permeabilize with 0.1%–1% Triton X-100 (Nacalai Tesque) in PBS for 10 min at RT (15°C–25°C).
Wash the cells with 200 μL PBS-T and block with 200 μL 20% Blocking One (Nacalai Tesque, Japan) in PBS-T for 1 h at RT (15°C–25°C).
Apply primary antibodies (diluted in 20% Blocking One in PBS-T) to the cells overnight (16–24 h) at 4°C.
Note: List of primary antibodies for each stage.

On the next day, wash the cells with PBS-T and counterstain with 6-diamidino-2-phenylindole (DAPI) (Roche Diagnostics, Switzerland) and secondary antibodies.
Note: Secondary antibodies conjugated to Alexa Fluor 488, 647, or CF488, 568 are used to visualize primary antibodies.
Quantify the positive versus total cells (DAPI-positive cells) using ImageXpress Micro cellular imaging system (Molecular Devices). For optimal differentiation efficiency at each stage, please refer to expected outcomes[href=https://www.wicell.org#expected-outcomes]. Troubleshooting 5[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.9].
Real-time PCR protocol for differentiated hPSC spheroids
Timing: 1 day
Collect cell spheroids at day 3 (definitive endoderm), 8 (pancreatic progenitor), 13 (endocrine progenitor), and 21 (endocrine cell) for real-time analysis. This is used as a checkpoint to evaluate the differentiation efficiency of cells.
Using a 5 mL serological pipette, mix gently 2–3 times to obtain an equilibrium mixture of cell spheroids in the culture well.
Then, using a P200 pipette, collect 50 μL of cell spheroids at each stage.
Extract total mRNA using the RNeasy micro-kit, All prep (DNA/RNA) Micro Kit (Qiagen, Germany), or Cica geneus RNA Prep Kit.
Perform reverse transcription (with 1 μg of total mRNA) using PrimeScript™ RT Master Mix (Takara, Japan).
Perform real-time PCR with SyberGreen on a StepOne Plus (Applied Biosystems, Foster City, CA).
